hero.title: Eclipse Con
hero.tagline: Where Eastern elegance meets untamed spirit

about.title: About Eclipse Con
about.paragraph1: Eclipse Con is a celebration where the timeless beauty of Japanese art and mythology meets the vibrant creativity of the furry community. Set against a backdrop of paper lanterns and torii gates, our convention invites you to explore a world where tradition and imagination intertwine.
about.paragraph2: From ukiyo-e–inspired art showcases to lively matsuri festivities, every corner of Eclipse Con is designed to immerse you in a unique cultural experience. Whether you're an artist, a performer, or a passionate fan, you'll find your place among kindred spirits.
about.highlight: Three days of art, culture, and community under the eclipse moon.

events.title: Events & Activities
events.subtitle: From dusk till dawn, every hour brings something extraordinary.

panels.title: Panels & Talks
panels.description: Artist spotlights, worldbuilding workshops, and community discussions led by talented creators from around the globe.

workshops.title: Craft Workshops
workshops.description: Hands-on sessions in traditional Japanese crafts — origami, sumi-e ink painting, fursuit patterning, and more.

matsuri.title: Matsuri Dance
matsuri.description: Our signature evening festival featuring bon-odori dances, taiko drums, and a spectacular lantern parade.

art.title: Art Exhibition
art.description: A curated gallery of original works blending Japanese aesthetics with anthropomorphic character art.

cosplay.title: Cosplay Contest
cosplay.description: Showcase your finest fursuits and cosplay creations on stage, judged by renowned costume designers.

dealers.title: Dealer's Den
dealers.description: Browse and shop from over a hundred artists and vendors offering prints, plushies, accessories, and commissions.

guests.title: Featured Guests
guests.subtitle: Meet the artists and creators shaping our community.

guest1.name: Hikaru Mori
guest1.bio: Renowned for blending traditional sumi-e techniques with modern character design, Hikaru's work has graced gallery walls from Tokyo to Berlin.

guest2.name: Sable Kitsune
guest2.bio: A master craftsperson whose kitsune-inspired fursuits have won multiple awards at international conventions and captivated audiences worldwide.

guest3.name: Ren Tanaka
guest3.bio: Blending shamisen melodies with electronic beats, Ren creates soundscapes that bridge centuries of Japanese musical tradition with modern grooves.

venue.title: The Venue
venue.name: Sakura Grand Convention Center
venue.description: Nestled along the waterfront with panoramic views of the bay, the Sakura Grand offers 50,000 square feet of convention space, multiple ballrooms, and an outdoor garden perfect for our evening matsuri celebrations.

registration.title: Registration
registration.subtitle: Secure your spot at the eclipse.

q1.question: What is Eclipse Con?
q1.answer: Eclipse Con is a Japanese-themed furry convention celebrating art, culture, and community. It brings together artists, performers, and fans for three days of panels, workshops, exhibitions, and evening matsuri festivities.

q2.question: Is there an age requirement?
q2.answer: Attendees must be 18 years or older. A valid government-issued ID is required at check-in.

q3.question: Can I get a refund on my ticket?
q3.answer: Full refunds are available up to 30 days before the event. After that, tickets may be transferred to another person but are non-refundable.

q4.question: Are fursuits required?
q4.answer: Absolutely not! While fursuits are welcome and celebrated, most attendees come in casual attire. Cosplay of any kind is encouraged but never required.

q5.question: How do I become a vendor or panelist?
q5.answer: Applications for Dealer's Den vendors and panel hosts open six months before the convention. Follow us on social media for announcements.
